title: Traditions of Edinburgh.
author: Chambers, Robert
snippet: About 1745, the London bag brought on one occasion no more than a single letter, addressed to the British Linen Company. From the Parliament Square the office was removed to Lord Covington's house, above described ; thence, after some years, to a house in North Bridge Street ; and thence, finally, to the present extensive buildings in Waterloo Place.

title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 20
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: "Left wheel!" The band and the Major riding behind it swung round thecorner into North Bridge Street; the rear-rank and the adjutant behindit passed down the Lawnmarket. Our driver was touching up his horses tofollow, when Flora's hand stole into mine.

title: St. Ives: being the adventures of a French prisoner in England. [Completed by A. T. Quiller-Couch.]
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: And I pitied him a little; for whilehis eyes rested on Flora, hers wandered to the rear of the thirdcompany, where Ensign Ronald Gilchrist marched beside thetattered colours with chin held up and a high colour on hisyoung cheeks and a lip that quivered as he passed us. ' God bless you, Ronald !''Left wheel!' The band and the Major riding behind itswung round the corner into North Bridge Street; the rearrank and the adjutant behind it passed up the Lawnmarket. Our driver was touching up his horses to follow, when Flora'shand stole into mine.
